items.title: Ford CEO calls for 'comprehensive' tariff analysis for all countries
items.content: Farley singled out imports from Japan and South Korea that have little to no duties compared to the 25% tariff threatened on Canada and Mexico.

items.title: Ford beats earnings expectations but forecasts tougher year ahead
items.content: Ford Motor beat Wall Street's top- and bottom-line expectations for the fourth quarter but forecast a tougher year ahead for the company.
items.contentSnippet: Ford Motor beat Wall Street's top- and bottom-line expectations for the fourth quarter but forecast a tougher year ahead for the company.

items.title: Trump's China tariff increase will affect Ford and GM vehicles, billions of dollars in auto parts
items.content: The biggest impact on vehicles is on Ford Motor's Lincoln Nautilus and General Motors' Buick Envision.
items.contentSnippet: The biggest impact on vehicles is on Ford Motor's Lincoln Nautilus and General Motors' Buick Envision.

items.title: Cosm considers international expansion of immersive sports-viewing venues

items.title: National Women's Soccer League agrees to $5 million settlement over past mistreatment of players

items.title: Remains of all 67 people killed in D.C. aircraft collision recovered, officials say
items.content: The bodies of all 67 people killed in the collision of an American Airlines regional jet with an Army helicopter have been recovered, officials said Tuesday.
items.contentSnippet: The bodies of all 67 people killed in the collision of an American Airlines regional jet with an Army helicopter have been recovered, officials said Tuesday.

items.title: GM cuts 50% of Cruise staff after ending robotaxi business
items.content: General Motors is laying off roughly half its employees who remain at its discontinued Cruise robotaxi business.
items.contentSnippet: General Motors is laying off roughly half its employees who remain at its discontinued Cruise robotaxi business.

items.title: Walmart's latest acquisition is a shopping mall in Pennsylvania
items.content: Walmart's purchase was an all-cash $34 million deal, according to CBL, a shopping mall owner that sold the property.

items.title: New York City office demand is finally back to normal
